page.title: 14INFANT EDUCN, NEWTON MEARNS
page.content: There are no State Nursery Schools in the area so under-fives attend the nearby nursery at Giffnock Primary School which caters for almost sixty infants aged 4-5. One class have morning, the other afternoon sessions five days a week. The children learn through play with jigsaws, sand, counting-beads and toys. They are taught simple songs, poems, basic reading skills and crafts such as clay modelling. There are several local playgroups run several mornings a week by mothers of children who do not go to nursery. Most receive council subsidies to pay for the hire of a church or town hall, but ask a small fee per child for the cost of toys, paints etc. These groups are mainly for enjoyment and offer little emphasis on learning as the staff are untrained.
